title: Android support for EFrame, including support for suspend + resume events
body:
<!--
First look if there is already a similar bug report. If there is, add a comment to it instead!

Please also check if the bug is still present in latest master! Do so by adding the following lines to your Cargo.toml:


[patch.crates-io]
egui = { git = "https://github.com/emilk/egui", branch = "master" }
# if you're using eframe:
eframe = { git = "https://github.com/emilk/egui", branch = "master" }
-->

**Describe the bug**
As a continuation of the work started with https://github.com/emilk/egui/pull/1634 it would also be good to update EFrame to be able to defer the initialization of render state until the app is first resumed (and be able to re-create windows/surfaces for further Suspend/Resumed events) so that EFrame can be used to build Android applications.

Right now if you try and run an EFrame based application on Android you will simply get a black screen.

<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. An image is good, a gif or movie is better! -->

**To Reproduce**

The Android example here can potentially be used to reproduce this: https://github.com/rib/android-activity/tree/eframe/examples/agdk-eframe - though there's a chicken / egg situation since that test has actually been updated to work with [a branch](https://github.com/rib/egui/commits/eframe-android) I will submit as a PR soon.


**Expected behavior**
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->

It should be possible to run an eframe application on Android with input handling and correct rendering, as well as be able to suspend and resume when switching between applications.
